aboutUs.text1: Welcome to AirLink, where our mission is to connect the world with comfort, safety, and service excellence. With years of experience in the industry, we take pride in offering affordable and efficient flights to a wide variety of destinations. Our commitment is to provide you with an unforgettable travel experience, with exceptional customer service and cutting-edge technology that ensures your peace of mind on every journey.
aboutUs.text2: Discover the most fascinating destinations with AirLink. From paradise beaches to vibrant cosmopolitan cities, we offer flights to the most sought-after places by our passengers. Some of our most popular destinations include: New York, USA – The city that never sleeps, full of culture and entertainment. Paris, France – The capital of romance and fashion. Tokyo, Japan – A perfect blend of tradition and modernity. Cancún, Mexico – Spectacular beaches and a vibrant nightlife. Madrid, Spain – History, art, and gastronomy in the heart of Spain. No matter your ideal destination, we are here to take you there with the best flight experience.
aboutUs.text3: At AirLink, we reward your loyalty with our exclusive Loyalty Program. As a member, you can enjoy incredible benefits, including: Earning points for every flight, redeemable for tickets and class upgrades. Access to VIP lounges at selected airports. Priority boarding and seat selection. Exclusive discounts on hotels and partner services. Joining is easy and free. Simply register on our website and start enjoying all the perks of being part of our frequent traveler community. Travel more and earn more with AirLink!

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: AirLink Privacy Policy - How we collect, use and protect your personal information

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.p1: At AirLink, we respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal data. This privacy policy will inform you about how we look after your personal data when you visit our website or use our services, and tell you about your privacy rights and how the law protects you.
introduction.p2: Please read this privacy policy carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding your personal data. By using our services, you accept the practices described in this policy.

dataCollection.title: Information We Collect
dataCollection.p1: We may collect, use, store and transfer different kinds of personal data about you, which we have grouped together as follows:

list.item1: Identity Information: includes first name, last name, username or similar identifier, marital status, date of birth, gender, passport or ID number.
list.item2: Contact Information: includes billing address, delivery address, email address and telephone numbers.
list.item3: Financial Information: includes payment card details and bank account details.
list.item4: Transaction Information: includes details about payments to and from you, and details of services you have purchased from us, such as flights, seats, additional baggage, etc.
list.item5: Technical Information: includes IP address, login data, browser type and version, time zone setting and location, browser plug-in types and versions, operating system and platform, and other technology on the devices you use to access our website.
list.item6: Profile Information: includes your username and password, purchases or orders made by you, your interests, preferences, feedback and survey responses.

dataUse.title: How We Use Your Information
dataUse.p1: We use your personal information for the following purposes:

list.item1: To manage your account and provide you with our services, including booking flights, managing your frequent flyer program, and communicating changes to services.
list.item2: To process and deliver your order, including managing payments, fees and charges, and collecting money owed to us.
list.item3: To manage our relationship with you, including notifying you about changes to our terms or privacy policy, and asking you to leave a review or take a survey.
list.item4: To personalize your experience and deliver content and product offerings relevant to you.
list.item5: To improve our website, products/services, marketing, and customer relationships.

dataSharing.title: Sharing Your Personal Data
dataSharing.p1: We may share your personal data with the following parties:

list.item1: Service providers who perform services on our behalf, such as payment processing, data analysis, email delivery, customer service, etc.
list.item2: Airport authorities, government and border control agencies, as required by law or to facilitate your travel.
list.item3: Business partners with whom we offer products or services in conjunction, such as hotels, car rental companies, or insurance companies.
list.item4: Third parties to whom we may choose to sell, transfer or merge parts of our business or our assets. Alternatively, we may seek to acquire other businesses or merge with them. If a change happens to our business, the new owners may use your personal data in the same way as set out in this privacy policy.

cookies.title: Cookies and Similar Technologies
cookies.p1: We use cookies and similar technologies to distinguish your preferences from other users of our website. This helps us to provide you with a good experience when you browse our website and also allows us to improve it.
cookies.p2: You can set your browser to refuse all or some browser cookies, or to alert you when websites set or access cookies. If you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of this website may become inaccessible or not function properly.

security.title: Data Security
security.p1: We have put in place appropriate security measures to prevent your personal data from being accidentally lost, used or accessed in an unauthorized way, altered or disclosed. In addition, we limit access to your personal data to those employees, agents, contractors and other third parties who have a business need to know.
security.p2: We have put in place procedures to deal with any suspected personal data breach and will notify you and any applicable regulator of a breach where we are legally required to do so.

rights.title: Your Legal Rights
rights.p1: Under certain circumstances, you have rights under data protection laws in relation to your personal data, including the right to:

list.item1: Request access to your personal data.
list.item2: Request correction of your personal data.
list.item3: Request erasure of your personal data.
list.item4: Object to processing of your personal data.
list.item5: Request restriction of processing your personal data.

changes.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.p1: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Any changes we make to our privacy policy in the future will be posted on this page and, where appropriate, notified to you by email.

contact.title: Contact
contact.p1: If you have any questions about this privacy policy or our privacy practices, please contact our Data Protection Officer at:

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.description: AirLink Terms and Conditions - Rules and regulations for using our services

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.p1: These Terms and Conditions ('Terms') govern your use of the services offered by AirLink ('we', 'our', 'the Company'), including our website, mobile applications, and air transportation services.
introduction.p2: By accessing or using our services, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you disagree with any part of these Terms, you may not access our services.

item1.definition: The document entitled 'Passenger Ticket and Baggage Check' or 'Electronic Ticket' issued by us or on our behalf, and includes the Conditions of Contract and notices.

item2.definition: Any person, except members of the crew, carried or to be carried in an aircraft with our consent.

item3.definition: The two or three letters or the letter and number which identify a particular airline.

item4.definition: Unusual and unforeseeable circumstances beyond our control, the consequences of which could not have been avoided even if all due care had been exercised.

bookings.title: Bookings and Tickets
bookings.p1: Reservations are not considered confirmed until full payment has been made and a ticket or booking number has been issued. We reserve the right to cancel a reservation if payment is not received within the specified timeframe.
bookings.p2: Tickets are personal and non-transferable. The person whose name appears on the ticket is the only one authorized to travel. We may request photo identification at the time of boarding.
bookings.p3: It is the passenger's responsibility to ensure that all information provided during booking is correct. Errors in names, dates, or destinations may result in the inability to travel and change fees may apply.

fares.title: Fares and Payments
fares.p1: Fares apply only for carriage from the airport at the point of origin to the airport at the point of destination, unless expressly stated otherwise. Fares do not include ground transport service between airports and city terminals.
fares.p2: Fares may change without prior notice, but once a confirmed ticket has been issued, the fare will not change unless the booking is modified or the fare conditions are changed.
fares.p3: Certain taxes, fees, and charges are imposed by government or airport management authorities. These may not be included in the fare and will be shown separately on the ticket or itinerary.

checkin.title: Check-in and Boarding
checkin.p1: Passengers must present themselves for check-in at least 2 hours before the scheduled departure time for domestic flights and 3 hours for international flights. The check-in counter closes 45 minutes before the scheduled departure.
checkin.p2: Passengers who do not present themselves in time for check-in or boarding may be considered as 'no-shows' and may lose their right to travel without refund.

baggage.title: Baggage
baggage.p1: Each passenger is entitled to a specific baggage allowance, which varies according to the route and travel class. Baggage exceeding the allowed allowance will be subject to additional charges.
baggage.p2: Certain items are prohibited or restricted in checked and carry-on baggage. It is the passenger's responsibility to familiarize themselves with these restrictions before traveling.
baggage.p3: AirLink is not liable for damage to or loss of fragile, perishable, or specially valuable items, unless they have been specifically declared and an additional charge has been paid.

refunds.title: Changes, Cancellations, and Refunds
refunds.p1: Conditions for changes, cancellations, and refunds vary according to the type of fare purchased. More economical fares usually have more severe restrictions.
refunds.p2: Refund requests must be made within 12 months of the date of issue of the original ticket. Refunds will be processed in the same form of payment used for the purchase.
refunds.p3: In case of flight cancellation by AirLink, we will offer alternative travel options or a full refund, in accordance with applicable regulations.

liability.title: Liability
liability.p1: Our liability for damages in case of death or bodily injury of a passenger is limited by applicable international conventions and national legislation.
liability.p2: We are not liable for damages resulting from compliance with any law or government regulation, or from your failure to comply with the same.

changes.title: Changes to These Terms
changes.p1: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Modifications will take effect immediately after their publication on our website. Your continued use of our services after such modifications will constitute your acceptance of the new terms.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Answers to the most common questions about AirLink services
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most frequently asked questions about our services, policies, and procedures.

bookings.title: Bookings and Tickets
bookings.q1: How can I book a flight with AirLink?
bookings.a1: You can book a flight through our official website, our mobile app, by calling our call center at +34 678-323-040, or through authorized travel agencies.
bookings.q2: Can I modify my booking after confirming it?
bookings.a2: Yes, you can modify your booking through the 'My Bookings' section on our website or app, or by contacting our customer service. Please note that change fees may apply depending on the type of fare purchased.
bookings.q3: What happens if I miss my flight?
bookings.a3: If you miss your flight, you should contact our customer service as soon as possible. Depending on your fare, we may offer you options to travel on a later flight, although additional charges may apply.
bookings.q4: How can I get my boarding pass?
bookings.a4: You can get your boarding pass by checking in online through our website or app (available from 48 hours to 1 hour before departure), or at the airport check-in counters.

checkin.title: Check-in and Boarding
checkin.q1: When does check-in open for my flight?
checkin.a1: Check-in counters generally open 3 hours before the scheduled departure and close 45 minutes before for domestic flights and 60 minutes before for international flights.
checkin.a2: Yes, online check-in is available from 48 hours to 1 hour before the flight departure through our website or mobile app.
checkin.q3: What documentation do I need to travel?
checkin.a3: For domestic flights, you will need a valid ID card or passport. For international flights, you will need a valid passport and, depending on the destination, possibly a visa. It is the passenger's responsibility to ensure they have all the necessary documentation.

baggage.title: Baggage
baggage.q1: What is the allowed baggage allowance?
baggage.a1: Baggage allowance varies according to the route and travel class. Generally, in economy class, one checked bag of up to 23 kg and one carry-on bag of up to 10 kg are allowed. In business class, two checked bags of up to 32 kg each are allowed.
baggage.q2: Can I carry liquids in my hand luggage?
baggage.a2: Yes, but with restrictions. Liquids must be in containers of no more than 100 ml each, and all containers must fit in a transparent, resealable plastic bag of no more than 1 liter capacity.
baggage.q3: What items are prohibited in baggage?
baggage.a3: Items such as weapons, explosives, flammable, toxic, or corrosive substances are prohibited in both checked and carry-on baggage. For a complete list, please refer to our 'Prohibited Items' section on our website.
baggage.q4: What do I do if my baggage is lost or damaged?
baggage.a4: If your baggage is lost or damaged, you must report it immediately at the lost property office at the airport before leaving the terminal. There, you will be provided with a Property Irregularity Report (PIR) form that you must complete.

special.title: Special Services
special.q1: Do you offer assistance for passengers with reduced mobility?
special.a1: Yes, we offer full assistance for passengers with reduced mobility or special needs. Please notify us at least 48 hours before your flight so we can prepare everything necessary.
special.q2: Can I travel with my pet?
special.a2: Yes, we allow the transport of pets both in the cabin (for small animals) and in the hold, subject to certain restrictions and with an additional charge. You must notify us at least 48 hours in advance.
special.q3: Do you offer special menus on board?
special.a3: Yes, we offer various special menus, including vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, kosher, halal, among others. These must be requested at least 24 hours before the flight departure.

TravelInfo.title: Useful Travel Information
TravelInfo.description: Important information for your trip with AirLink: documentation, pets, and minors

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.intro: To ensure a hassle-free journey, it is essential that all passengers carry the necessary documentation.
documentation.validPassport: Passport valid for at least 6 months from the date of entry to the destination country
documentation.visa: Visa or travel authorization (if required by the destination country)
documentation.warning: Lack of proper documentation may result in denied boarding without the right to a refund.
documentation.recommendation1: Check the specific documentation requirements for your destination country at least 3 months in advance.
documentation.recommendation2: Verify your passport's validity and ensure it has enough blank pages.
documentation.recommendation3: Carry physical and digital copies of your important documents.
documentation.recommendation4: Check if you need vaccination certificates for your destination.
documentation.specialCasesDescription: Citizens with dual nationality should check specific regulations, as some countries require that you use the passport of your country of origin to exit and the passport of your destination country to enter.
documentation.tip1: Save a digital copy of your documents in your email or in the cloud.
documentation.tip2: Always carry an additional ID document besides your passport.
documentation.tip3: Check if you need an international driving permit if you plan to rent a car at your destination.

pets.title: Traveling with Pets
pets.intro: At AirLink, we understand that pets are part of the family. That's why we offer options for them to travel with you, either in the cabin or in the cargo hold of the aircraft.
pets.cabinCarrier: Soft carrier with maximum dimensions of 45 x 35 x 25 cm
pets.cabinLimit: Maximum one pet per passenger and up to 2 pets per cabin
pets.holdCarrier: Rigid carrier approved for air transport
pets.holdTemperature: Not available on routes with extreme temperatures for the safety of the animal
pets.warning: Pet reservations are subject to availability and must be made at least 48 hours in advance.
pets.document1: Veterinary certificate of good health (issued maximum 10 days before the flight)
pets.document2: Updated vaccination record (including rabies vaccine for dogs and cats)
pets.document3: Microchip or identification tattoo (mandatory for international travel)
pets.document4: Additional specific documentation according to the destination country
pets.restrictedBreedsDescription: For safety reasons, the following dog breeds cannot travel in the cabin and have special restrictions for traveling in the cargo hold:
pets.internationalTravelDescription: For international travel, each country has specific requirements for the entry of animals. It is the passenger's responsibility to inform themselves and comply with these requirements, which may include quarantines, antiparasitic treatments, or additional certificates.
pets.serviceAnimalsDescription: Guide dogs and properly accredited emotional support animals can travel in the cabin at no additional cost, regardless of their weight. Documentation certifying their condition and training is required.
pets.tip1: Get your pet accustomed to the carrier several weeks before travel.
pets.tip2: Do not feed your pet 4-6 hours before the flight to avoid motion sickness.
pets.tip3: Place an item with your scent inside the carrier to reassure your pet.
pets.tip4: Make sure your pet has exercised before the flight so they are more relaxed.
pets.bookingDescription: Pet transportation has an additional cost that varies according to the size of the animal and whether it travels in the cabin or in the cargo hold. To book, contact our customer service or add the service during the online booking process.

children.title: Minors, Children, and Infants
children.intro: Traveling with children can be a wonderful experience. At AirLink, we strive to make the journey as comfortable and safe as possible for the whole family.
children.infantsDescription: Infants are passengers who have not reached 2 years of age on the date of the flight:
children.infantsPoint1: They can travel on an adult's lap with a special belt provided by the crew.
children.infantsPoint2: Reduced fare: generally 10% of an adult ticket price for domestic flights and 10-15% for international flights.
children.infantsPoint3: No checked baggage allowance, but a stroller and a car seat are allowed at no additional charge.
children.infantsPoint4: It is recommended to book a separate seat with an approved car seat for greater safety.
children.childrenDescription: Children between 2 and 11 years must occupy their own seat:
children.childrenPoint1: Reduced fare: generally 75% of an adult ticket price.
children.childrenPoint3: Children's menu available (must be requested at least 24 hours in advance).
children.unaccompaniedDescription: We offer a special service for minors traveling alone:
children.unaccompaniedPoint1: Available for children aged 5 to 17 years (mandatory up to 12 years).
children.unaccompaniedPoint2: Dedicated staff who accompany the minor throughout the process.
children.unaccompaniedPoint4: Must be booked at least 48 hours in advance.
children.unaccompaniedPoint5: Not available on flights with connections or on the last flights of the day.
children.warning: Minors under 18 traveling alone or accompanied by only one parent or guardian may need additional documentation, especially for international travel.
children.document1: Valid ID or passport for all minors, regardless of age.
children.document2: For minors traveling with only one parent: authorization from the other parent (mandatory in some countries).
children.document3: For unaccompanied minors: unaccompanied minor form completed and signed by the parent/guardian.
children.document4: For international travel: check the specific requirements of the destination country, which may include notarized permits.
children.tip1: Book seats together in advance, preferably in the front of the aircraft.
children.tip2: Bring enough snacks, toys, and entertainment to keep children occupied.
children.tip3: For infants, bring extra diapers, wipes, and a change of clothes in your carry-on luggage.
children.tip4: Consider flying during the child's usual sleep hours.
children.tip5: Explain to older children what to expect during the trip to reduce anxiety.
children.specialServicesDescription: We offer additional services such as bottle warming, baby cribs (subject to availability), priority boarding for families with young children, and entertainment kits for children on long-haul flights.
